#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=THE HUSSY
#Text=THERE are some stories that have to be true — the sort that cannot be fabricated by a ready fiction-reckoner .
#Text=And by the same token there are some men with stories to tell who cannot be doubted .
#Text=Such a man was Julian Jones .
#Text=Although I doubt if the average reader of this will believe the story Julian Jones told me .
#Text=Nevertheless I believe it .
#Text=So thoroughly am I convinced of its verity that I am willing , nay , eager , to invest capital in the enterprise and embark personally on the adventure to a far land .

#Text=It was in the Australian Building at the Panama Pacific Exposition that I met him . I was standing before an exhibit of facsimiles of the record nuggets which had been discovered in the goldfields of the Antipodes .
#Text=Knobbed , misshapen and massive , it was as difficult to believe that they were not real gold as it was to believe the accompanying statistics of their weights and values .
#Text=“ That ’s what those kangaroo-hunters call a nugget , ” boomed over my shoulder directly at the largest of the specimens .
#Text=I turned and looked up into the dim blue eyes of Julian Jones .
#Text=I looked up , for he stood something like six feet four inches in height .
#Text=His hair , a wispy , sandy yellow , seemed as dimmed and faded as his eyes .
#Text=It may have been the sun which had washed out his colouring ; at least his face bore the evidence of a prodigious and ardent sun-burn which had long since faded to yellow .
#Text=As his eyes turned from the exhibit and focussed on mine I noted a queer look in them as of one who vainly tries to recall some fact of supreme importance .
#Text=“ What ’s the matter with it as a nugget ? ” I demanded .
#Text=The remote , indwelling expression went out of his eyes as he boomed
#Text=“ Why , its size . ”
#Text=“ It does seem large , ” I admitted .
#Text=“ But there ’s no doubt it ’s authentic .
#Text=The Australian Government would scarcely dare — ”
#Text=“ Large ! ” he interrupted , with a sniff and a sneer .
#Text=“ Largest ever discovered — ” I started on .
#Text=“ Ever discovered ! ”
#Text=His dim eyes smouldered hotly as he proceeded .
#Text=“ Do you think that every lump of gold ever discovered has got into the newspapers and encyclopedias ? ”
#Text=“ Well , ” I replied judicially , “ if there ’s one that has n’t , I do n’t see how we ’re to know about it .
#Text=If a really big nugget , or nugget-finder , elects to blush unseen — ”
#Text=“ But it did n’t , ” he broke in quickly .
#Text=“ I saw it with my own eyes , and , besides , I ’m too tanned to blush anyway .
#Text=I ’m a railroad man and I ’ve been in the tropics a lot .
#Text=Why , I used to be the colour of mahogany — real old mahogany , and have been taken for a blue-eyed Spaniard more than once — ”
#Text=It was my turn to interrupt , and I did .
#Text=“ Was that nugget bigger than those in there , Mr. — er — ? ”
#Text=“ Jones , Julian Jones is my name . ”
#Text=He dug into an inner pocket and produced an envelope addressed to such a person , care of General Delivery , San Francisco ; and I , in turn , presented him with my card .

#Text=“ Pleased to know you , sir , ” he said , extending his hand , his voice booming as if accustomed to loud noises or wide spaces . “ Of course I ’ve heard of you , seen your picture in the papers , and all that , and , though I say it that should n’t , I want to say that I did n’t care a rap about those articles you wrote on Mexico .
#Text=You ’re wrong , all wrong .
#Text=You make the mistake of all Gringos in thinking a Mexican is a white man .
#Text=He ai n’t .
#Text=None of them ai n’t — Greasers , Spiggoties , Latin-Americans and all the rest of the cattle .
#Text=Why , sir , they do n’t think like we think , or reason , or act .
#Text=Even their multiplication table is different .
#Text=You think seven times seven is forty-nine ; but not them .
#Text=They work it out different .
#Text=And white is n’t white to them , either .
#Text=Let me give you an example .
#Text=Buying coffee retail for house-keeping in one-pound or ten-pound lots — ”
#Text=“ How big was that nugget you referred to ? ” I queried firmly .
#Text=“ As big as the biggest of those ? ”
#Text=“ Bigger , ” he said quietly .
#Text=“ Bigger than the whole blamed exhibit of them put together , and then some . ”
#Text=He paused and regarded me with a steadfast gaze .
#Text=“ I do n’t see no reason why I should n’t go into the matter with you .
#Text=You ’ve got a reputation a man ought to be able to trust , and I ’ve read you ’ve done some tall skylarking yourself in out-of-the-way places .
#Text=I ’ve been browsing around with an eye open for some one to go in with me on the proposition . ”
#Text=“ You can trust me , ” I said .

#Text=And here I am , blazing out into print with the whole story just as he told it to me as we sat on a bench by the lagoon before the Palace of Fine Arts with the cries of the sea gulls in our ears .
#Text=Well , he should have kept his appointment with me .
#Text=But I anticipate .

#Text=As we started to leave the building and hunt for a seat , a small woman , possibly thirty years of age , with a washed-out complexion of the farmer ’s wife sort , darted up to him in a bird-like way , for all the world like the darting veering gulls over our heads and fastened herself to his arm with the accuracy and dispatch and inevitableness of a piece of machinery .
